Comment: The King's Pawn opening. This is my normal opening move as white. I learned this move at a chess club at high school when I was 14, as it frees the queen and light-square bishop.
Scandinavian defence. My opponent is obviously looking to develop his queen should I capture his pawn...
...which is exactly what I do, transposing to the Lasker variation. I couldn't resist here, as I do like to create space to give my pieces more freedom...
...but it prompts him to bring out his queen into the centre of the board to get ahead in development, keeping with the Lasker variation...
...so I bring out mine to contest the long light diagonal. The first time I remember this in a mini-tournament game, my opponent captured my queen, allowing my knight to come out and recapture...
...but she doesn't capture her just yet, she moves across to check my king...
...so I put mine in front of him to keep chasing her around...
...and this time she captures her, making me think "which pawn to I use to recapture?"...
...and I decide to use my queen's pawn to keep a more even connection on both sides.
This series of moves allowed him to develop his bishop...
...so I develop mine to contest the b1-h7 diagonal...
...forcing an exchange. I have two connected pawns on one side of the hole, and five on the other. Was he inviting these exchanges?
...forcing an exchange. I have two connected pawns on one side of the hole, and five on the other. Was he inviting these exchanges?
He now develops his knight...
...so I do the same...
...and as he castles queenside, his rooks are now four squares apart, so my knight is eyeing up the f7 square, hoping to win a rook.
So I advance my knight to the 5th rank to attack the f7 square. There was one snag: his knight can cover by moving to h6, and my pawn on e3 is blocking the bishop's path...
...so he does the expected move, covering the f7 square with his knight.
What was I doing castling kingside, when my pawn on d3 was under attack from my rook?
He captures it, as I expected. Now I'm in trouble here, with an enemy rook on my 3rd rank.
Was I panicking here? I move out my knight to develop a piece on my third rank, but I had no idea what to do next.
